content: The "Microcap Fraud Prevention Act of 2001" is the short title of this Act. It includes amendments to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. SEC. 6. Broadening of penny stock bar. Section 15(b)(6) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to broaden the penny stock bar by replacing references to penny stock with noncovered security and making adjustments to clauses related to securities offerings and persons subject to orders under specific sections. The amendment broadens the penny stock bar under Section 15(b)(6) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 by replacing references to penny stock with noncovered security. It defines terms related to participation in offerings of noncovered securities, including activities like acting as a promoter or engaging in trading activities. The amendment excludes certain persons or classes from this definition. The amendment broadens the penny stock bar under Section 15(b)(6) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 by excluding certain persons or classes as determined by the Commission. Court authority to prohibit offerings of noncovered securities. Section 21(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to give courts the authority to prohibit individuals who violated section 10(b) from participating in offering noncovered securities. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to allow courts to prevent individuals who violated section 10(b) from involvement in noncovered securities offerings, which involve activities like promotion, finding, consulting, or acting as an agent in the issuance or trading of noncovered securities. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to specify additional activities that the Commission can regulate, while also allowing for exemptions of certain individuals or classes by the Commission. SEC. 8. BROADENING OF OFFICER AND DIRECTOR BAR. Amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to broaden the scope of officer and director bars. SEC. 9. VIOLATIONS OF COURT ORDERED BARS. Prohibits individuals under an order from serving as officers, directors, or participants in offerings involving noncovered securities in violation of the order.
